intro: Phoberos gaertneri var. oblongifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phoberos, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a unique and exotic plant.
